text.0: tvastar prepares the bridal of his daughter all the world hears the tidings and assembles.
text.1: but yamas mother spouse of great vivasvān vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.
text.2: from mortal men they hid the immortal lady made one like her and gave her to vivasvān.
text.3: saranyu brought to him the aśvin brothers and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.
text.4: guard of the world whose cattle neer are injured may pūṣan bear thee hence for he hath knowledge.
text.5: may he consign thee to these fathers keeping and to the gracious gods let agni give thee.
text.6: may Āyu giver of all life protect thee and bear thee forward on the distant pathway.
text.7: thither let savitar the god transport thee where dwell the pious who have passedbefore thee.
text.8: pūṣan knows all these realms may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger.
text.9: giver of blessings glowing allheroic may he thewise and watchful go before us.
text.10: pūṣan was born to move on distant pathways on the road far from earth and far from heaven.
text.11: to both most wonted places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.
text.12: the pious call sarasvatī they worship sarasvatī while sacrifice proceedeth.
text.13: the pious called sarasvatī aforetime sarasvatī send bliss to him who giveth.
text.14: sarasvatī who camest with the fathers with them rejoicing thee in our oblations.
text.15: seated upon this sacred grass be joyful and give us strengthening food that brings no sickness.
text.16: thou called on as sarasvatī by fathers who come right forward to our solemn service.
text.17: give food and wealth to present sacrificers a portion worth a thousand of refreshment.
text.18: the mother floods shall make us bright and shining cleansers of holy oil with oil shall cleanse us.
text.19: for goddesses they bear off all defilement i rise up from them purified and brightened.
text.20: through days of earliest date the drop descended on this place and on that which was before it.
text.21: i offer up throughout the seven oblations the drop which still to one same place is moving.
text.22: the drop that falls thy stalk which arms have shaken which from the bosom of the press hath fallen.
text.23: or from the adhvaryus purifying filter i offer thee with heart and cry of vaṣaṭ.
text.24: that fallen drop of thine the stalk which from the ladle fell away.
text.25: this present god bṛhaspati shall pour it forth to make us rich.
text.26: the plants of earth are rich in milk and rich in milk is this my speech.
text.27: and rich in milk the essence of the waters make me pure therewith.
